alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; McCormick; Orangeburg; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 11:56PM EDT until June 27 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northern Aiken County in central South Carolina... Saluda County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... Northeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1154 PM EDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms was located between McCormick and Batesburg-Leesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Lexington, Cayce, Batesburg-Leesville, Oak Grove, Red Bank, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, South Congaree, Ridge Spring, Edgefield County Airport, Saluda County Airport, Columbia Metro Airport, Aiken Municipal Airport, Swansea, Wagener, Pelion, Gilbert, Summit and Monetta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 20 and 63. Interstate 26 near mile marker 106. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Murray move away from the water and take shelter!

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; McCormick; Orangeburg; Saluda
